SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth

Class DMARCMessageHandler

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth.DMARCMessageHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
MIMEHandler, MessageHandler
public class DMARCMessageHandler extends Object implements MessageHandler
A tee MessageHandler that intercepts the From header for DMARC validation.

This handler:

  • Intercepts addressHeader("From", ...) to extract the From domain
  • Delivers the domain to a registered consumer (typically DMARCValidator)
  • Proxies all events to an optional delegate MessageHandler

Usage in AuthPipeline: 


 FromDomainCallback callback = new FromDomainCallback() {
     public void onFromDomain(String domain) {
         dmarcValidator.setFromDomain(domain);
     }
 };
 DMARCMessageHandler dmarcHandler = new DMARCMessageHandler(callback, userHandler);
 dkimParser.setMessageHandler(dmarcHandler);
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • DMARCValidator
  • AuthPipeline

      public DMARCMessageHandler(DMARCMessageHandler.FromDomainCallback fromDomainCallback, MessageHandler delegate)

  • Method Details

    • addressHeader

      public void addressHeader(String name, List<EmailAddress> addresses) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
      Receive notification of an address header in the message. Some header fields (e.g. From, Sender) will only have one address. Others (To, Cc, Bcc) may have multiple addresses. The addresses list will never be empty. If the value in the underlying message did not contain valid addresses it will be reported via unexpectedHeader.
      Specified by:
      addressHeader in interface MessageHandler
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the header field, e.g. "From", "To"
      addresses - a non-empty list of parsed email addresses
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • setLocator

      public void setLocator(MIMELocator locator)
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive an object for the location of MIME parsing events. This method will be called once prior to any other events. The handler can examine the locator when it receives any event and be informed of the end position of the event.
      Specified by:
      setLocator in interface MIMEHandler
      Parameters:
      locator - the object for event parsing location information

    • startEntity

      public void startEntity(String boundary) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive notification of the beginning of a MIME entity. For the root entity, the boundary parameter will be null. For nested entities in a multipart body, the boundary parameter will be the MIME boundary string that started this entity.
      Specified by:
      startEntity in interface MIMEHandler
      Parameters:
      boundary - the MIME boundary that started this entity, or null for the root entity
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • contentTransferEncoding

      public void contentTransferEncoding(String encoding) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive notification of a Content-Transfer-Encoding header in the current entity. The argument to this method will be a token, either one of the 5 predefined ones (base64, quoted-printable, 8bit, 7bit, binary), or a string token beginning with "x-" i.e. an x-token. All tokens should be treated as case-insensitive although they will be provided here verbatim as they occur in the entity.
      Specified by:
      contentTransferEncoding in interface MIMEHandler
      Parameters:
      encoding - the content transfer encoding value
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • endHeaders

      public void endHeaders() throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive notification that all the headers in an entity have been parsed. There will be no more header events issued for this entity, although if there are nested entities in a multipart content then they will have their own header sections. The handler implementation can now expect one of:
      • bodyContent: for raw body content data for a non-multipart entity
      • startEntity: for a new nested entity if this is a multipart entity
      • endEntity: to terminate the current entity
      Specified by:
      endHeaders in interface MIMEHandler
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • bodyContent

      public void bodyContent(ByteBuffer data) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive notification of the byte content of an entity. This method will be called only if the entity is not a multipart content type. Multiple invocations of this method may occur before the end of the entity. The content has been decoded according to the Content-Transfer-Encoding. Appropriate action must still be taken to convert it to a suitable representation, such as using the charset parameter in a text/plain entity to convert byte data to character data.
      Specified by:
      bodyContent in interface MIMEHandler
      Parameters:
      data - a buffer containing the body content data, ready for reading
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • unexpectedContent

      public void unexpectedContent(ByteBuffer data) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive notification of unexpected body content. This is content that is:
      • at the start of a multipart entity where the first boundary would be expected (preamble), or
      • after the end boundary of a multipart entity (epilogue)
      Specified by:
      unexpectedContent in interface MIMEHandler
      Parameters:
      data - a buffer containing the body content data, ready for reading
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • endEntity

      public void endEntity(String boundary) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MIMEHandler
      Receive notification that a MIME entity has been completely parsed. For the root entity, the boundary parameter will be null. For nested entities in a multipart body, the boundary parameter will be the MIME boundary string that ended this entity.
      Specified by:
      endEntity in interface MIMEHandler
      Parameters:
      boundary - the MIME boundary that ended this entity, or null for the root entity
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • header

      public void header(String name, String value) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
      Receive notification of an unstructured header in the message. Headers are fields that occur at the beginning of a message or body part. They contain a name and an optional value.

      Header values may be continued over multiple lines in the underlying message data. The value supplied here is the logical value of the header after any line unfolding and decoding of non-ASCII characters performed according to RFC 2047.

      Specified by:
      header in interface MessageHandler
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the header (field-name, cannot be null)
      value - the header value (field-body, may be null)
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • unexpectedHeader

      public void unexpectedHeader(String name, String value) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
      Receive notification of a structured header field for which the value was unparseable. This indicates a malformed message, but handlers may choose to log or ignore these events instead of throwing an exception.
      Specified by:
      unexpectedHeader in interface MessageHandler
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the header (field-name, cannot be null)
      value - the header value (field-body, may be null)
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • messageIDHeader

      public void messageIDHeader(String name, List<ContentID> contentIDs) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
      Receive notification of a message-id header in the message. Some header fields (e.g. Message-ID) will only have one ID. Others (References, In-Reply-To) may have multiple IDs. The contentIDs list will never be empty. If the value in the underlying message did not contain valid message-ids it will be reported via unexpectedHeader.
      Specified by:
      messageIDHeader in interface MessageHandler
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the header field, e.g. "Message-ID", "References"
      contentIDs - the parsed message-id values (same structure as Content-ID)
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • obsoleteStructure

      public void obsoleteStructure(ObsoleteStructureType type) throws MIMEParseException
      Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
      Receive notification of an obsolete but recoverable message structure. This method will be called before the corresponding normal parsing event to allow handlers to gather statistics on obsolete structures while still processing the message content normally.
      Specified by:
      obsoleteStructure in interface MessageHandler
      Parameters:
      type - the type of obsolete structure detected
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process
